title: Several injured in Tel Aviv car-ramming attack as Israel continues West Bank military operation
description: Israeli police say multiple people were injured in a car ramming and stabbing attack in Tel Aviv as Israeli forces carry out a military operation in the occupied West Bank. NBC News’ Josh Lederman reports on whether the Tel Aviv attack could be related and the international community's response to Israel's operation that has left at least 10 Palestinians dead.

title: CTE diagnosed in a female professional athlete for the first time
description: Researchers in Australia say they have diagnosed a professional female athlete with chronic traumatic encephalopathy, a progressive degenerative brain disease caused by repeated head injuries, for the first time.

title: Taliban administration orders beauty salons in Afghanistan to close
description: Taliban ordered beauty salons to close within a month in the latest shrinking of access to public places for Afghan women

title: U.N. gives Japan a stamp of approval for Fukushima water release
description: Japan won IAEA's approval to release Fukushima waste water into the sea despite opposition from local fishing unions and neighbouring countries

title: Former Georgian president bares his chest during court appearance
description: A former president of Georgia, Mikheil Saakashvili, who is serving six years in prison for abuse of power, lifted his shirt to show that he had lost weight and that his ribs were prominent, amid claims he has been poisoned.

title: Some in Scotland’s Orkney Islands want to return to Norway after 550 years
description: Sick of being ignored by far-away politicians, officials on Scotland’s remote Orkney Islands are mulling a drastic solution: rejoining Norway, the Scandinavian country that gave them away as a royal wedding dowry more than 550 years ago.

title: Russia says it foiled Ukrainian drone attack on Moscow as Kyiv’s counteroffensive grinds on
description: Russian air defenses on Tuesday foiled a Ukrainian drone attack on Moscow that prompted authorities to briefly close one of the city’s international airports, officials said, as a Western analysis said Russia has managed to slow Kyiv’s recently launched counteroffensive.

title: Kevin Spacey sexual offense trial underway in London
description: Kevin Spacey is back in a London courtroom for another day of testimony as the disgraced actor faces multiple charges of sexual offenses spanning several years. NBC News legal analyst Danny Cevallos breaks down what Spacey is charged with and how his legal team is reacting to the allegations.

title: Russian people are more united than ever, Putin says
description: President Vladimir Putin told a forum of Asian leaders that the Russian people were more united than ever, in his first appearance before an international assembly since June's short-lived mutiny.

title: Israel’s biggest military operation in the West Bank in 20 years﻿ kills 10 and sends thousands fleeing
description: Israel has launched its largest military operation in the occupied West Bank in some 20 years, sending streams of civilians fleeing and raising fears of a significant escalation after months of rising violence.

title: Taiwan's army holds live fire drills on island's south coast
description: Taiwanese artillery trainees shot down aerial targets during live fire drills, video released by Taiwan’s military showed.

title: Watch: July's supermoon glows in the night sky
description: July's full moon orbits closer to the Earth than many others this year, making it a supermoon, with a larger and brighter appearance.

title: China imposes export curbs on chipmaking metals in tech war with the U.S.
description: China announced restrictions on exports of two metals key to the manufacturing of semiconductors, escalating a tech war with Europe and the United States.

title: France braces for another night of protests in response to shooting
description: After a week of unrest, France is preparing for more protests that are in response to the killing of a 17-year-old-boy by a police officer at a traffic stop in Paris. France's interior ministry will deploy 45,000 police officers throughout the country. NBC News' Matt Bradley has the latest.
